DataElement.preferredName: Positron Emission Tomography Standardized Uptake Value Maximum Finding Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The category that describes maximum standardized (by total body weight) uptake value among the pixels within a region of interest when exposed to a positron emission tomography scan.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Positron Emission Tomography Standardized Uptake Value Maximum Finding
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered.:The maximum standardized uptake value among the pixels (voxels) within a region of interest._Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A noninvasive imaging method that provides information about cellular activity (metabolic information).  It is used along with magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) which provides information about the shape and size of the tumor (spatial information).

Concepts.definition: A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered.

Property.preferredDefinition: The maximum standardized uptake value among the pixels (voxels) within a region of interest._Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease.

Concepts.definition: The maximum standardized uptake value among the pixels (voxels) within a region of interest.
Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding of normality following an examination or investigation looking for the presence of a microorganism, disease, or condition.

Concepts.definition: A finding of normality following an examination or investigation looking for the presence of a microorganism, disease, or condition.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Low Level Standardized Uptake Value Maximum
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating a low level._The maximum standardized uptake value among the pixels (voxels) within a region of interest.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating a low level.
The maximum standardized uptake value among the pixels (voxels) within a region of interest.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Greater Than Positive Two And Half Standardized Uptake Value Maximum
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status._An integer with a value greater than zero._A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._One of two equal parts; a quantity corresponding to one half of the whole._The maximum standardized uptake value among the pixels (voxels) within a region of interest.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status.
An integer with a value greater than zero.
A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
One of two equal parts; a quantity corresponding to one half of the whole.
The maximum standardized uptake value among the pixels (voxels) within a region of interest.
